meanings.definition: A unit of power equal to 550 foot-pounds per second
meanings.sent1: The tractor had enough horsepower to pull the heavy load effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: The car's engine produces 200 horsepower, making it quite powerful.
meanings.sent3: The horse asked the farmer if it could measure its own horsepower.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was the horsepower that drove her to success.
meanings.sent5: The spaceship's engines roared with the force of a thousand horsepower.

meanings.definition: The power of a horse; a unit of power equal to the power needed to lift 550 pounds one foot in one second.
meanings.sent1: The old steam engine had more horsepower than the new electric one.
meanings.sent2: The farmer calculated the horsepower needed to plow the field efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The horse boasted about its impressive horsepower to the other farm animals.
meanings.sent4: His charisma was the horsepower behind his ability to influence others.
meanings.sent5: The waterfall's roar echoed with the raw power of a thousand horsepower.
